707686f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 103rd St.
707686f-a.text:
First Avenue at S.E. corner of 103rd Street, Harlem Market.
September 2, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

714961f-a.title: Manhattan: 103rd Street (East) - 1st Avenue
714961f-a.text:
East 103rd Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of First Ave. The view shows a dead end alley at the rear of First Ave., that projects southward towards East 102nd Street. The wooden garages, at the right, occupy the
lot of No. 340.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

707687f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 103rd St.
707687f-a.text:
First Avenue at N.W. corner of 103rd Street.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

707688f-a.text:

First Avenue, west stde and routh of 103rd Street.
(2)

showing Broach of Pro. Ex. Bank.
(3)

P.L.Speer.
9O REPNOU:TION.  April 14, 1940.

714957f-b.title: Manhattan: 103rd Street (East) - 1st Avenue
714957f-b.text:
(1)
425 East 103rd Strcet, north side east of First Ave. This is a portion. of the pathway, which will be cleared for the East River Drive.
32SS.  October 17, 1934.
NeeC
N. LESperr.
S
S.
(2)
The same, at a later date, at a point slightly eastward.
August 31, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

714959f-a.title: Manhattan: 103rd Street (East) - 1st Avenue
714959f-a.text:
East 103rd Street (rear view) south side, east of First Ave., to the Harlem River. Space shown in the foreground, is the Harlem Farmer's Sqquare.
September 21, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
